verse:
सर्वेन्द्रियगुणाभासं सर्वेन्द्रियविवर्जितम्‌।
सर्वस्य प्रभुमीशानं सर्वस्य शरणं सुहृद्॥

terms.सर्वेन्द्रियगुणाभासं: sarvendriyaguṇābhāsaṁ: The one who possesses all the qualities and characteristics of the senses.
terms.सर्वस्य प्रभुमीशानं: sarvasya prabhumiśānaṁ: The Lord and Master of all.
terms.सर्वस्य शरणं सुहृद्: sarvasya śaraṇaṁ suhṛd: The refuge and true friend of all.
terms.Overall, this verse highlights the all: encompassing nature, transcendence, and compassion of the Supreme Being. It reminds us to seek refuge in the divine and acknowledge the divine's presence in all aspects of life.

meaning: Meaning:This verse describes the divine qualities of the Supreme Being. The first line states that the Supreme Being shines forth with the qualities and characteristics of all the senses. However, in the second line, it is said that the Supreme Being is beyond the limitations of the senses, implying a transcendental nature. The third line establishes that the Supreme Being is the Lord and Master of all, emphasizing supreme authority and control. Finally, the fourth line conveys that the Supreme Being is the ultimate refuge and sincere friend to all beings.
